about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: A curb painted blue means parking is:

about.name: A curb painted blue means parking is:

hasPart.assesses: A curb painted blue means parking is: | A curb painted blue means parking is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A blue curb indicates an area where parking is permitted only for a disabled person, or driver of a disabled person, who displays a placard or special license plate for disabled persons or disabled veterans.

suggestedAnswer.text: Allowed for no longer than 15 minutes.

comment.text: Allowed for no longer than 15 minutes.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only allowed when picking up or dropping off passengers.

comment.text: Only allowed when picking up or dropping off passengers.

suggestedAnswer.text: For disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

comment.text: For disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

acceptedAnswer.text: For disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

comment.text: For disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

answerExplanation.text: A blue curb indicates an area where parking is permitted only for a disabled person, or driver of a disabled person, who displays a placard or special license plate for disabled persons or disabled veterans.

comment.text: A curb painted blue means parking is: | A blue curb indicates an area where parking is permitted only for a disabled person, or driver of a disabled person, who displays a placard or special license plate for disabled persons or disabled veterans.

hasPart.name: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb?

about.name: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb?

hasPart.assesses: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb? | Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels into the curb or toward the side of the road. Set the parking brake.

comment.text: Into the curb
Away from the curb
Parallel to the curb
Into the curb

answerExplanation.text: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels into the curb or toward the side of the road. Set the parking brake.

comment.text: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb? | When parking downhill, turn your front wheels into the curb or toward the side of the road. Set the parking brake.

hasPart.name: As your speed increases, it is important to:

about.name: As your speed increases, it is important to:

hasPart.assesses: As your speed increases, it is important to: | As your speed increases, it is important to: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Your vehicle's stopping distance increases as your speed increases. When driving at high speeds, it is important to look well ahead of your vehicle to allow yourself space to safely react to hazardous situations.

comment.text: Turn on your headlights.

suggestedAnswer.text: Look well ahead of your vehicle.

comment.text: Look well ahead of your vehicle.
Change lanes frequently.

acceptedAnswer.text: Look well ahead of your vehicle.

comment.text: Look well ahead of your vehicle.

answerExplanation.text: Your vehicle's stopping distance increases as your speed increases. When driving at high speeds, it is important to look well ahead of your vehicle to allow yourself space to safely react to hazardous situations.

comment.text: As your speed increases, it is important to: | Your vehicle's stopping distance increases as your speed increases. When driving at high speeds, it is important to look well ahead of your vehicle to allow yourself space to safely react to hazardous situations.

hasPart.name: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:

about.name: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:

hasPart.assesses: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may: | A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A red arrow means "stop." You must remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn in that direction after slowing and checking for traffic.

comment.text: Turn in that direction after slowing and checking for traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.

comment.text: Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop.

comment.text: Turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop.

acceptedAnswer.text: Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.

comment.text: Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.

answerExplanation.text: A red arrow means "stop." You must remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow.

comment.text: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may: | A red arrow means "stop." You must remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: Prior to entering a curve:
hasPart.assesses: Prior to entering a curve: | Prior to entering a curve: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

comment.text: Activate your turn signal.
Reduce your speed.
Brake hard.
Reduce your speed.

answerExplanation.text: You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

comment.text: Prior to entering a curve: | You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

hasPart.name: What does this road sign mean?

about.name: What does this road sign mean?

hasPart.assesses: What does this road sign mean? | What does this road sign mean? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that merging traffic will be entering from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow the incoming traffic to safely merge.

suggestedAnswer.text: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.

comment.text: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.
Always stop.
Divided highway ahead.

acceptedAnswer.text: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.

comment.text: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that merging traffic will be entering from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow the incoming traffic to safely merge.

comment.text: What does this road sign mean? | Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that merging traffic will be entering from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow the incoming traffic to safely merge.
